headline.main: Space Steering Device Patented; Handles Pitch, Roll and Yaw Moves for Astronaut VARIETY OF IDEAS IN NEW PATENTS

headline.main: TIPS ON TRAVELING BY CAR WITH CHILDREN IN TOW

results.snippet: THE average American family will drive 9,400 miles this year and probably will vacation by car, with the children in tow; 85.5 per cent of all Americans do so.

headline.main: DISCOVERING A DREAM ISLAND; Grand Turk in the British West Indies Gets a Strong Vote From a Traveler Seeking His Own Paradise Isle

results.snippet: COCKBURN, TOWN, Grand Turk, B.W.I. -- There is a determined, although unorganized, tribe of travelers whose wanderings are largely motivated by an untiring search for what they call their island.

results.abstract: Daughter born; he, wife and baby illus

headline.main: 6 1/2-Pound Girl Born to Soviet Astronaut Couple; A Girl Baby Is Born to Space Couple

results.snippet: MOSCOW, June 10 -- Mrs. Valentina V. Nikolayeva-Tereshkova, the first woman to be orbited in space, has given birth to a healthy girl of six and a half pounds. The father is Lieut. Col. Andriyan G. Nikolayev, also an astro naut.

byline.original: By HENRY TANNERSpecial to The New York Times

results.abstract: FAA and Flight Safety Foundation plan 3d crash to test air bag system for protecting passengers

headline.main: Air Safety Bag to Get 2d Test In Staged Arizona Plane Crash

results.snippet: An air bag that apparently "saved" a dummy passenger's life in a staged plane crash will be given another severe test when a second airliner is destroyed late this summer.
results.lead_paragraph: An air bag that apparently "saved" a dummy passenger's life in a staged plane crash will be given another severe test when a second airliner is destroyed late this summer.

results.abstract: D S Broder article on qualifications for a great Senator lists ability to go to heart of issue, diligence, and breadth of interest; cites late Pres Kennedy views; discusses celebrity types seeking office

headline.main: What Makes a Great Senator?; Some men may be elected to the Senate because they are 'names' in other fields. Will this benefit that body by broadening it or does it require special qualifications? What Makes a Great Senator?

results.snippet: WASHINGTON. IN Oklahoma this spring a famous football coach, Bud Wilkinson, easily defeated two professional politicians for the Republican nomination for the United States Senate. In Ohio, astronaut John Glenn won over 200,000 votes in the...
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON. IN Oklahoma this spring a famous football coach, Bud Wilkinson, easily defeated two professional politicians for the Republican nomination for the United States Senate. In Ohio, astronaut John Glenn won over 200,000 votes in the Democratic primary against the incumbent Senator, even though he had withdrawn from the race.

results.abstract: USAF repts Ling-Temco-Vought develops 125-lb TV camera, maneuvered by 16 jet nozzles, to be sent from manned spaceships, relay photos of nearby objects and return; unit, tested aboard KC-135 plane, to be tested in space soon; other uses suggested

headline.main: AIR FORCE TESTING 'BABY SATELLITE'; Device Could Be Used for Delivery of Supplies

results.snippet: A small, remote-controlled "baby satellite" that could be sent out from a manned spaceship to inspect nearby objects with a television camera is being tested by the Air Force.
results.lead_paragraph: A small, remote-controlled "baby satellite" that could be sent out from a manned spaceship to inspect nearby objects with a television camera is being tested by the Air Force.

results.abstract: at least 7 killed as 2 USAF transports with 24 aboard collide off Bermuda; map

headline.main: 7 DEAD, 10 MISSING AS PLANES COLLIDE; 7 Other Airmen Are Rescued Off Coast of Bermuda

results.snippet: HAMILTON, Bermuda, June 29 -- Two United States Air Force planes collided in the air today while engaged in spaceflight exercises near here, killing at least 7 of the 24 crewmen aboard.
results.lead_paragraph: HAMILTON, Bermuda, June 29 -- Two United States Air Force planes collided in the air today while engaged in spaceflight exercises near here, killing at least 7 of the 24 crewmen aboard.
